item.description:
Steampunk is awesome, i'll say it again and again. If you're looking to expand your portfolio a little bit and have a great time then this is the place you want to be. Here's the info for the picnic.

Hello! Join us for the Third Annual New England Steampunk Picnic in beautiful Plymouth Massachusetts!

Sited on the waterfront, it is immediately next to Plymouth Rock and the Mayflower II. Ample shade and a number of nearby vendors/restaurants for foodstuffs make the site very comfortable, and with the majority of the tourists gone, there should be ample parking along the Park and on Water Street.
A VERY short walk across the street is beautiful Brewster Gardens, the location of many weddings; a path from the Gardens leads upstream to one of the oldest existing grist mills in the country, with a working water wheel (and ice cream parlor, BTW!).

We hope you will bring a potluck item to share, and will have a largish table set up for food items. We will have a stove and kettle provided for hot beverages such as tea. In fact, feel free to bring your tea cups!
We recommend you bring your own seating to ensure your comfort.
Weather Permitting, we will bring out the Victrola to 'crank out' some tunes! If you have some 78s, feel free to bring them with and I'll supply the needles!

NOTE however that alcoholic beverages are NOT permitted in the Park at any time....

And being historic Plymouth, there are many places to see such as the massive (and surprisingly, little visited) Founders Monument; the Pilgrim's Gravesites at Burial Hill, Pilgrim Hall Museum, and I believe there is a Cemetery Tour conducted from the Park for a small fee.
I will direct interested parties to the sights as they request.

For those that the Lady Raven and I are acquainted with, we will be retiring after the picnic to our home nearby for a casual evening with a fire pit and sheltered by my 20 foot Geodesic Dome. Be aware we have two small dogs, Shiba Inus, and they are little attention hogs.

The Commuter Rail trains from Boston stop at Plymouth Station a couple miles up the road from the Park....we will provide some shuttle service for those arriving. Plan on the Saturday schedule being in effect....and keep our phone number handy. We will update at a later time with a cell number for day-of-the-event contact.
Please, be courteous and phone us a few days in advance if you will need a ride from the Train and back again......

RAIN DATE: Saturday Sept. 17th!
item.how_to_find_us: Call us when you arrive. 1-800-210-9531. We'll be the guys with the cameras.
item.name: New England 3rd Annual Steampunk Picnic
